0.title: Journalist Describes An 'Almost Unimaginable' Crisis In Venezuela
0.description: Times reporter Nicholas Casey was in Maracaibo, Venezuela, in March 2019 during a six-day power outage. "By the fourth day," he says, "you started to hear shots getting fired in the street."

1.title: Venezuela is in the dark after a nationwide power outage that Nicolás Maduro blamed on 'American imperialism'
1.description: A massive blackout has hit most of Venezuela, an anomaly even for a country that has frequent power shortages. President Nicolás Maduro blamed "American imperialism" for starting an "electricity war" with the Venezuelan people. Critics say the power grid is d…

2.title: U.S. blacklists Venezuelan state banks after arrest of Guaido aide
2.description: The United States imposed sanctions on Friday on Venezuela's development bank, Bandes, a day after the Trump administration warned there would be consequences for the arrest by Venezuelan authorities of opposition leader Juan Guaido's top aide.

3.title: Power out, water scarce, looting: Venezuela in crisis. Will Trump administration react?
3.description: Democrats in Congress are readying a proposal that would bar President Trump from taking any military intervention without their authorization.

4.title: Special Report: How Russia sank billions of dollars into Venezuela quicksand
4.description: At the end of 2015, managers at Rosneft, the Russian state-controlled oil firm, sounded the alarm to their bosses about the company's investments in Venezuela. Rosneft's local partner, Venezuelan state oil company PDVSA, owed it hundreds of millions of dollar…

5.title: US announces withdrawal of last of its embassy personnel from Venezuela
5.description: The U.S. announced late Monday that it is pulling the remaining staff from its embassy in Venezuela.

6.title: Venezuelan forces kidnap opposition leader Juan Guaido's chief of staff in raid
6.description: Venezuelan armed intelligence officers descended on the apartment of Roberto Marrero, a lawyer and top adviser to opposition leader Juan Guaido.

7.title: State attorneys general: Donald Trump's national emergency declaration is constitutional
7.description: In declaring a state of emergency, President Trump is using pre-existing statutory authority to address a legitimate crisis.

8.title: Rubio Says Venezuelan Explosion Occurred At ‘German Dam’ But There’s One Problem
8.description: The Republican senator's comments on Venezuela's power outages came back to bite him on Saturday.

9.title: So far, so good for British bonds as Brexit storm rages
9.description: For all the Brexit tumult, one thing that has remained strong and stable -- to borrow a phrase Prime Minister Theresa May once used to describe her leadership -- is demand for British government debt.

10.title: Pompeo: Testy when asked about Trump issues, from North Korea to Otto Warmbier in exclusive interview
10.description: Pompeo took the opportunity to say many issues weren't the creation of the Trump administration.

11.title: US cutting off humanitarian aid to Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador
11.description: The United States is halting humanitarian funding to Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador, just days after Trump warned of a new migrant caravan heading toward the U.S. border.

12.title: Here’s why Cuba has painfully slow Internet – and what Google’s doing to fix it
12.description: Yesterday, Google announced it’s teaming up with Cuba’s telecommunications monopoly, ETECSA, in order to bring faster Internet access to the island. The news is no doubt a relief for Cuba’s citizenry, who have to endure high Internet costs and excruciatingly …

13.title: Algerian unrest a potential threat to Cuban coffers
13.description: Cuba faces yet another threat to its exports of health services in exchange for oil and money as social unrest roils old friend Algeria, even as a new deal to mitigate declining support from crisis-racked Venezuela kicks in.

14.title: Venezuela's Former Vice President Charged in U.S. With Evading Sanctions
14.description: Venezuela’s Minister of Industry and National Production was charged with violating a U.S. law targeting foreign drug traffickers with sanctions by using private jets supplied by American companies.

15.title: The Two Presidents Are Linked By Their Insecure, Tough-Guy Grievance Politics
15.description: The twin presidents of the United States and Brazil are linked most closely by the insecure, tough-guy grievance politics that fuel them both.

16.title: The Ongoing Crisis In Venezuela
16.description: 'New York Times' reporter Nicholas Casey was in Maracaibo, Venezuela, in March 2019 during a six-day power outage that left 30 million people in the dark. "By the fourth day," he says, "you started to hear shots getting fired in the street." Shortages of food…

17.title: Massive Venezuela power outage raises tensions amid crisis
17.description: Venezuela’s worst-ever power outage Friday raised tensions in a country already on edge from ongoing political turmoil.

18.title: Perspective | Juan Guaidó: If Maduro arrests me, it 'would be a coup d'etat' - The Washington Post
18.description: Perspective | Juan Guaidó: If Maduro arrests me, it 'would be a coup d'etat' The Washington Post Venezuela crisis: Juan Guaidó to return after tour BBC News ‘Losing support by the hour’: Venezuela’s Maduro will be out of power soon, Colombian president says T…

19.title: 'The party of healthcare': How Donald Trump is reshaping his strategy post-Mueller
19.description: Donald Trump used a Grand Rapids rally to debut a post-Mueller strategy that includes reviving battles on healthcare, immigration and other issues.

20.title: Marco Rubio Mistakes Venezuelan Journalist Named Germán Dam for an Actual Dam
20.description: In a tweet over the weekend, the Florida senator mistook a journalist covering the crisis in Venezuela, Germán Dam, for a hydroelectric barrier.

21.title: U.S. pulling last of its embassy personnel from Venezuela
21.description: Move comes as blackout continues and desperation spreads across much of nation in grips of political crisis and hyperinflation

22.title: White House to announce new sanctions on Cuba over Maduro support, source says - Fox News
22.description: White House to announce new sanctions on Cuba over Maduro support, source says Fox News US ramps up Venezuela sanctions as Guaido tours South America | Al Jazeera English Al Jazeera English Guaidó Vows Prompt Return to Venezuela as Absence Saps Opposition’s M…

23.title: Venezuelans facing 'unprecedented challenges,' many need aid - internal U.N. report
23.description: The United Nations estimates that about a quarter of Venezuelans are in need of humanitarian assistance, according to an internal U.N. report seen by Reuters on Thursday that paints a dire picture of millions of people lacking food and basic services.

24.title: How Russia sank billions of dollars into Venezuelan quicksand - Reuters
24.description: How Russia sank billions of dollars into Venezuelan quicksand Reuters Russian oil company Rosneft spent a fortune on joint ventures in Venezuela even though it suspected it was losing out on millions of dollars, documents show.

25.title: Ilhan Omar Claims Trump Lying About Venezuela Crisis: 'Question the Narratives'
25.description: Rep. Ilhan Omar (D-MN) has accused President Donald Trump and his envoy to Venezuela of lying about the humanitarian crisis faced by the country, as the White House steps up its efforts to remove the Maduro regime from power.

26.title: Oil prices rise on OPEC's supply cuts and healthy demand
26.description: Oil prices rose on Tuesday, lifted by output cuts led by producer group OPEC as well as healthy demand, although analysts said economic headwinds posed downside risks to crude markets.

27.title: Taps Run Dry in Socialist Venezuela as Blackout Chokes Water Supply
27.description: Venezuelans are now experiencing chronic shortages of water as regular blackouts and prolonged power outages continue to choke the country's basic ability to function, raising further fears about the severity of the country's deepening humanitarian crisis.

28.title: Paris, Singapore and Hong Kong are the world's most expensive cities
28.description: Researchers from The Economist Intelligence Unit looked at the prices of 150 items in 133 cities round the world including the cost of food, clothing, transport and utility bills.

29.title: Justin Trudeau says he is 'disappointed' after top minister resigns as Canada PM plunged into fresh crisis
29.description: Canadian prime minister under increasing pressure over handling of an investigation into whether alleged bribes were paid by a multinational engineering company

30.title: Greece backs Bolivia's call for Venezuela dialogue instead of new elections
30.description: Greece on Friday backed calls by Bolivia’s left-wing President Evo Morales for a negotiated settlement in Venezuela instead of a call for new elections like the U.S. and other E.U. countries want.

31.title: Eduardo Bolsonaro: Force Will Be Needed in Venezuela Because ‘Maduro Is a Criminal’
31.description: Brazilian congressman Eduardo Bolsonaro, the son of the nation's president Jair Bolsonaro, said Friday that some sort of force would be necessary to oust the reigning Venezuela dictator Nicolás Maduro from office.

32.title: Senators introduce bipartisan bill to send $400 million in aid to Venezuela
32.description: Nicolás Maduro's government has recently escalated its efforts to fend off the leadership challenge by the U.S.-backed opposition leader Juan Guaidó

33.title: Melania Trump hosts wife of Venezuelan president recognized by the U.S. at Mar-a-Lago
33.description: First Lady Melania Trump lent her support to Fabiana Rosales, the wife of Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guiado, as the White House released smiling photos of the pair together.

34.title: Guaido arrives in Venezuela as supporters gather to protest
34.description: Declaring he knows he's at risk, opposition leader Juan Guaido returns to Venezuela to renew his campaign to topple the government of President Nicolas Maduro.

35.title: Maduro regime suggests Guaido behind Venezuelan blackouts
35.description: U.S backed opposition claims over 17 have died in power cuts

36.title: How the Green New Deal Is Forcing Politicians to Finally Address Climate Change
36.description: The Green New Deal, calling for the U.S. to decarbonize, is forcing all politicians to talk about climate change — not just the Democrats.

37.title: 1,000 Venezuelan security forces have crossed Colombia border
37.description: About 1,000 members of the Venezuelan security forces have fled to Colombia since last month, abandoning Nicolas Maduro's government, Colombian authorities said.

38.title: POLITICO Playbook PM: Deep dive into the O’Rourke marriage, and Paul Ryan’s new gig with Fox
38.description: And documents show special counsel Robert Mueller’s office began investigating Michael Cohen as early as July 2017.

39.title: Back in Venezuela, Guaido prepares to meet state workers
39.description: Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaido plans to meet with public employee unions to “recover” the state bureaucracy, which he says is being manipulated by Nicolas Maduro.

40.title: As Venezuela's Blackout Drags On, Protesters Fill The Streets Of Caracas
40.description: With some parts of Venezuela still experiencing power outages, opposition leader Juan Guaidó and President Nicolás Maduro held rival rallies in Caracas.

41.title: The U.S. is thinking of invading Venezuela. That’s unlikely to lead to democracy.
41.description: U.S. armed intervention has been bad for Latin America.

42.title: Transcript: Sen. Tim Kaine on "Face the Nation"
42.description: The following is a transcript of the interview with Democratic Sen. Tim Kaine of Virginia that aired Sunday, March 17, 2019, on "Face the Nation"

43.title: Chicago mayoral election 2019: State set to make history with first ever black woman governor
43.description: Women represent just 21 per cent of mayors in American cities with populations of 30,000 or more

44.title: Trump admin to let Americans sue some foreign firms doing business in Cuba
44.description: The Trump admin has long sought ways to toughen the U.S. economic embargo on Cuba and has rolled back some measures enacted by the Obama administration.

45.title: Trump praises Brazil's far-right president at White House
45.description: President Donald Trump praised Brazil’s Jair Bolsonaro during his White House visit, saying the man who’s been described as the “Trump of the Tropics” has done “a very outstanding job.”

46.title: U.S. military: Venezuela crisis boosting Colombian rebel threat
46.description: “It’s essentially a lawless region now inside Venezuela along the border and the FARC dissidents and the ELN have taken advantage of that,” U.S. Admiral Craig Faller said.

47.title: LAPD car chase ends with fugitive driver performing breakdance routine
47.description: Shapes were thrown as officers kept guns trained on suspect

48.title: Emily Maitlis announced as BBC Newsnight host in all-female presenting team
48.description: The broadcaster replaces Evan Davis as lead presenter

49.title: Woman tries to open plane door during flight before being restrained by passengers
49.description: Medical issue may be responsible for incident, says airport spokesperson

50.title: Pope Pius XII: Vatican to open secret archives on WWII-era pontiff accused of silence on Holocaust
50.description: The Vatican will open its secret archives on the Second World War-era pope Pius XII, who was accused by Jewish groups of staying silent on the Holocaust, Pope Francis has announced.

51.title: American Airlines apologises for removing mother and baby from flight over dry skin condition
51.description: 'I have never been so humiliated in my life!' Jordan Flake says

52.title: Goldman Sachs relaxes dress code for all employees
52.description: Banking giant had previously relaxed clothing policy for tech workers

53.title: R Kelly breaks down in bizarre first interview since sex abuse charges: 'I'm fighting for my f***ing life'
53.description: The musician has been released on bail after being charged with 10 counts of aggravated sexual abuse against four victims

54.title: Jaguar attacks woman after she steps into enclosure for photo
54.description: 'Not a wild animal's fault when barriers are crossed,' says zoo

55.title: Corey Jones trial: Ex-police officer Mouman Raja convicted in shooting of stranded black musician
55.description: First time in 30 years Florida has convicted officer over on-duty shooting

56.title: Indian government blows up $14 million mansion of fugitive jeweller
56.description: Jeweller Nirav Modi is now believed to be hiding in London.

57.title: Chinese database detailing 'breedready' status of millions of women discovered by researcher
57.description: Public cache of information includes phone numbers, addresses and ages of millions of women

58.title: Olivia Jade: Lori Loughlin's YouTuber daughter criticised for resurfaced video amid college admissions scandal
58.description: Olivia Jade Giannulli says in the clip that she's mainly interested in 'partying' and 'game days'

59.title: Frank Cali: Reputed boss of Gambino mob family shot dead outside New York home
59.description: Police found 53-year-old 'with multiple gunshot wounds to the torso'

60.title: President of European Parliament facing calls to resign after praising fascist dictator Mussolini
60.description: Antonio Tajani said Mussolini had done 'positive things'

61.title: Egypt's grand imam calls polygamy an 'injustice' for women
61.description: Sheikh Ahmed al-Tayeb argues practice comes from 'lack of understanding of the Quran and the tradition of the Prophet'

62.title: Man choked his Airbnb guest to death over unpaid £113 bill
62.description: Jason Colton threw guest against a wall and punched him unconscious, prosecutor tells jury

63.title: American Airlines apologises for removing mother and baby from flight over dry skin condition
63.description: 'I have never been so humiliated in my life!' Jordan Flake says

64.title: Carlos Ghosn: Ex-Nissan boss leaves Japanese jail disguised as workman after posting £7m bail
64.description: Dressed in dark blue cap, work jacket and face mask, ousted chairman slipped past photographers and into a minivan

65.title: Algeria protests: Concessions by president fail to stop demonstrations as cracks appear in regime
65.description: Member of Abdelaziz Bouteflika's own party says he is 'history'

66.title: Ontario set to ban pupils from using mobile phones in class
66.description: Government hopes ban will help distracted students focus on their learning

67.title: Father turns up at school with loaded AK-47 after his son FaceTimed him in tears
67.description: Christopher Freeman admits he was upset but didn't intend to harm anyone

68.title: Jussie Smollett: Empire producer says it's 'too early' to talk about actor's future on show
68.description: Smollett has been written out of the season's final two episodes, although he will appear in the seven that were filmed before the incident occurred.

69.title: Man dies after 12-hour hair transplant
69.description: Patient, 43, had reportedly asked for 9,000 hairs to be grafted in single sitting

70.title: Jussie Smollett pleads not guilty after being accused of faking racist and homophobic attack
70.description: Empire actor Jussie Smollett pleaded not guilty in a Chicago court on Thursday to charges that he falsely reported to police that he was the victim of a racist and homophobic assault on a city street.

71.title: Volkswagen boss apologises for Nazi gaffe after 'arbeit macht frei' pun
71.description: 'It was in fact a very unfortunate choice of words,' firm's CEO says
